clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Safety and Efficacy Study of Calcitriol 3 mcg/g Ointment in Pediatric Subjects With Plaque Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Open Label Uncontrolled Study of the Long Term Safety and Efficacy of Calcitriol 3 mcg/g Ointment Applied Twice Daily for 26 Weeks in Pediatric Subjects (2 to 17 Years of Age) With Mild to Moderate Plaque Psoriasis

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of up to 26 weeks of treatment with calcitriol 3 mcg/g ointment when used twice daily, without occlusion, to treat pediatric subjects (2 to 17 years of age) with mild to moderate plaque psoriasis.

primary_outcome.measure: Laboratory parameters related to calcium metabolism after 26 weeks of topical treatment with Calcitriol 3 mcg/g
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with serum albumin-adjusted calcium higher than the upper normal limit and/or PTH levels below the lower limit of normal. Incidence of urolithiasis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female 2 to 17 years of age
- Clinical diagnosis of stable mild to moderate plaque psoriasis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other forms of psoriasis
- Hypercalcemia
- Past history of kidney stones
- Vitamin D deficiency
- Other concomitant dermatological disease
